Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A hands-on, exploration-oriented course intended to help non-science major students understand physics involved in everyday items around the house.

PHY1038 - Physics of Energy, Climate Cha.name: PHY1038 - Physics of Energy, Climate Change and Environment

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic principles of physics, under the unifying theme of the production and use of energy and its interaction with the climate system and global environment.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to physics and the Physics Department research groups to prepare students for a successful physics career.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introductory course in physics designed for non-science majors, emphasizing topics relevant to everyday life. The course focuses on major physical discoveries and their implications for the world around us.

PHY2048 - General Physics Using Calculus.name: PHY2048 - General Physics Using Calculus I

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2311C  (or equivalent) with grade "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Physics I for scientists and engineers. Newtonian mechanics, kinematics, vectors, Newton's laws, work and conservation of energy and momentum, collisions, equilibrium, oscillations and waves.

PHY2048C - General Physics Using Calculu.name: PHY2048C - General Physics Using Calculus I Studio

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2311C (or equivalent) with grade "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Active learning course with combined lecture and lab. Calculus-based physics. Newtonian dynamics, gravity, work and conservation of energy and momentum, equilibrium, simple harmonic oscillators.

PHY2048K - Honors General Physics Using.name: PHY2048K - Honors General Physics Using Calculus I

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2311C (or equivalent) with grade "C" (2.0) or better, and permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as PHY 2048C    with honors-level content.

PHY2048L - General Physics Using Calculu.name: PHY2048L - General Physics Using Calculus I Laboratory

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PHY 2048 with grade of "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design, conduct experiments, create and evaluate models and make connections to physics principles. Make and record measurements, analyze and visualize data and uncertainties using calculus.

PHY2049 - General Physics Using Calculus.name: PHY2049 - General Physics Using Calculus II

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (PHY 2048 or PHY2048C) and MAC 2312 both with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Coulomb's law, electric fields and potentials, capacitance, currents and circuits, Ampere's law, Faraday's law, inductance, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic waves, ray optics, interference and diffraction.

PHY2049C - General Physics Using Calculu.name: PHY2049C - General Physics Using Calculus II Studio

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2312 and PHY 2048C with grades "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Active learning course with combined lecture and lab. Calculus-based physics. Electric and magnetic fields, circuits, induction, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic waves, ray optics, interference, diffraction.

PHY2049K - Honors General Physics Using.name: PHY2049K - Honors General Physics Using Calculus II

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2312 and PHY 2048C with grades "C" (2.0) or better, and permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as PHY 2049C    with honors-level content.

PHY2049L - General Physics Using Calculu.name: PHY2049L - General Physics Using Calculus II Laboratory

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PHY 2049 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design, conduct experiments, create and evaluate models and make connections to physics II principles. Make and record measurements, analyze and visualize data and uncertainties using calculus.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Kinematics, dynamics, Newton's laws of motion, Newtonian gravity, conservation of energy and momentum. Rotation, statics, basic principles of fluids. Simple harmonic oscillators.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 1105C and MAC 1114C or equivalent or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Active learning course with combined lecture and lab. Algebra-based physics. Newtonian dynamics, rotational motion, gravity, conservation of energy and momentum. Introduction to waves, fluids.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 1105C and MAC 1114C or C.I. and consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Mechanics, waves, thermodynamics. With Honors content.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PHY 2053 with grade of "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design and conduct experiments, create and evaluate models and make connections to physics principles. Make and record measurements, analyze and visualize data and uncertainties.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 2053 or PHY 2053C with "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamentals of electricity and magnetism. Lorentz force. Induction. Series and parallel DC circuits. RLC AC circuits. Ray optics, diffraction.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 2053C or (PHY 2053 and PHY 2053L) with "C" (2.0) or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Active learning course with combined lecture and lab. Algebra-based physics. Electric and magnetic fields, circuits, induction, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic waves, ray optics, interference, diffraction.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fluids, electricity, and magnetism, optics, x-rays, radioactivity. With Honors content.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PHY 2054 with a grade of "C" (2.0)  or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Design and conduct experiments, create and evaluate models and make connections to physics II principles. Make and record measurements, analyze and visualize data and uncertainties.

PHY3101 - General Physics Using Calculus.name: PHY3101 - General Physics Using Calculus III

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Thermodynamics, oscillations, modern physics.

PHY3101H - Honors General Physics Using.name: PHY3101H - Honors General Physics Using Calculus III

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 2049C, MAC 2313, and consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Same as PHY 3101 with honors-level content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Particle dynamics, rigid bodies, Lagrangian formulation of mechanics, Hamilton's equations.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Electrostatics, magnetostatics, Lorentz force current electricity, Maxwell's equations.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Thermodynamics, kinetic theory, elements of statistical mechanics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: State-of-the-art electronics, transducers, operational amplifiers, phase sensitive circuits, active filters.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applications, functions and operation of electronic instruments.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Laboratory work in basic measurements of physical constants; experiments in electronics, modern physics, nuclear physics, optics, and solid state physics.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed for students serving as Learning Assistants in the physics department and will help LAs to integrate educational theory, pedagogy and practice.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students build specialized matter required for teaching introductory physics by reviewing variety of physics concepts integrated with coherent teaching methods.

PHY4254 - Physics of Fluids and Biofluid.name: PHY4254 - Physics of Fluids and Biofluids

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 3513, PHY 3323, and MAP 2302, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ideal fluids; basic equation of fluid flow; viscous flow, instability and turbulence; thermal and mass transfers in fluids; biofluid mechanics of blood circulation.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Dielectrics, magnetic materials, electromagnetic waves, reflection, complex impedance, static solutions to Laplace's Equation, radiation from an accelerated charge and antennae, special relativity.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Wave optics, absorption, stimulated emission, lasers, transforms, coherence, holography.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles of laser gain media, properties of resonators and modes, and description of specific laser systems.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Postulates of quantum mechanics, operators and observables, Schroedinger equation with simple applications.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Further applications of quantum mechanics, perturbation theory, scattering theory, identical particles.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Experiments in optics, electronics, nuclear and solid state physics. Emphasis on design, data, and scientific writing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Directed Independent Research
